greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Distances between successive zeros in A051023, the middle column of rule-30 1-D cellular automaton, when started from a lone 1 cell.
comment: First differences of A327985, which gives indices of zeros in A051023.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: The evolution of one-dimensional cellular automaton rule 30 proceeds as follows, when started from a single alive (1) cell:

When noting up the distances between successive 0's in its central column (indicated here with parentheses), we obtain 6-2 (as the first 0 is on row 2, and the second is on row 6), 7-6, 10-7, 11-10, 12-11, ..., that is, the first terms of this sequence: 4, 1, 3, 1, 1, ...
program: A327980list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), s=25, n=2, on=n, k=0); while(k<up_to, n++; s = A269160(s); if(!((s>>n)%2), k++; v[k] = (n-on); on=n)); (v); }
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2019
